sentences.en: During the breeding season the birds come ashore.
sentences.cn: 在繁殖季节各种鸟都飞到岸边。

sentences.en: He laid hold of the rope and pulled the boat ashore.
He rowed her ashore and then continued trolling around the lake.
sentences.cn: 他拢岸让她下船，然后继续悠闲地在湖上划着。

sentences.en: He went ashore leaving me to start repairing the torn sail.
sentences.cn: 他上岸去了，留下我修理被撕破的船帆。

sentences.en: I was pitched into the water and swam ashore.
sentences.cn: 我被甩到水里后向岸边游去。

sentences.en: Several dead birds had been washed ashore.
She rowed ashore in the dinghy.
The band struck up as soon as the Queen stepped ashore.
sentences.cn: 女王一登岸乐队便开始奏乐.

sentences.en: The boat drifted ashore on an island.
sentences.cn: 小船漂浮到海岛的岸边.

sentences.en: The children got ashore before the tide came in.
sentences.cn: 涨潮前,孩子们就上岸了.

sentences.en: The currents drifted the dead body ashore.
sentences.cn: 潮流把尸体冲到岸边来了.

sentences.en: The marines went ashore as a spearhead this morning to capture key targets.
sentences.cn: 今天早晨，海军陆战队作为先头部队率先登陆以占领主要目标。

sentences.en: The oil washed ashore on roughly 1,000 miles of coastline.
sentences.cn: 石油沿着海岸线扩散到了大约1,000英里范围的沿岸海域。

sentences.en: The sea tided the debris ashore.
sentences.cn: 潮水把碎片杂物冲上海滩.

trans.tran_en: on or towards the shore of a lake, river, sea etc
